com.ibm.cloud.objectstorage.services.s3.internal

Enum FileLocks

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<FileLocks>
      • com.ibm.cloud.objectstorage.services.s3.internal.FileLocks
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<FileLocks>

    @ThreadSafe
public enum FileLocks
extends Enum<FileLocks>
    An internal utility used to provide both inter and intra JVM file locking. This works well as long as this class is loaded with the same class loader in a JVM. Otherwise, intra-JVM file locking is not guaranteed.

    Per javadoc of FileLock, "File locks are held on behalf of the entire Java virtual machine. They are not suitable for controlling access to a file by multiple threads within the same virtual machine."

    Hence the need for this utility class.

      • valueOf

        public static FileLocks valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)

      • lock

        public static boolean lock(File file)
        Acquires an exclusive lock on the specified file, creating the file as necessary. Caller of this method is responsible to call the FileLocks.unlock(File) method to prevent release leakage.
        Returns:
        true if the locking is successful; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        FileLockException - if we failed to lock the file

      • isFileLocked

        public static boolean isFileLocked(File file)
        Returns true if the specified file is currently locked; false otherwise.

      • unlock

        public static boolean unlock(File file)
        Unlocks a file previously locked via FileLocks.lock(File).
        Returns:
        true if the unlock is successful; false otherwise. Successful unlock means we have found and attempted to close the locking file channel, but ignoring the fact that the close operation may have actually failed.
